image.altText: an aboriginal man wearing traditional dress

props.synopsis: A respected religious leader from north-east Arnhem Land wants the No campaign to retract his image from its campaign material and publicly announce that it has done so.

title.children: 'No consent': Arnhem Land elder calls for Fair Australia to retract his image from campaign material

image.altText: An aerial photo of a line of fire along foliage in the desert

props.synopsis: As ranger groups in the NT's Top End use funding from carbon credits to prepare for a tough bushfire season, groups in the desert are calling for access to the same scheme.

title.children: Top End rangers are funding fire mitigation with carbon credits. Why can't it be done in the desert?

image.altText: A black and white portrait of a young man in a cowboy outfit.

props.synopsis: A gap year on a Top End cattle station opened the gate to a career as a professional rodeo rider for Will Reynolds — and an extensive list of injuries hasn't deterred him.

title.children: From Sydney surfer to US cowboy: How Will Reynolds fell in love with life in the ring

image.altText: An illustration of a SARS-CoV-2 virus particle showing the protruding spike proteins on the virus's surface.

props.synopsis: A new COVID variant nicknamed "Pirola" has been detected in Australia after sparking a sped-up vaccination program in the United Kingdom.

title.children: The 'highly mutated' COVID variant BA.2.86 — known as Pirola — has landed in Australia

image.altText: Von der Leyen can be seen in focus in between soldiers

props.synopsis: A former musician who was once forced to go into hiding from terrorists, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen's path to power has been an incredible journey.

title.children: How a young girl destined to become a 'housewife at the side of a powerful man' instead grew up to lead Europe through crisis

image.altText: Airbnb logo on a pink background with silhouetted figurines of travellers with bags in the foreground

props.synopsis: If there's a lesson from the evolution of the gig economy, it's that we don't yet know how AI will disrupt our economy and our lives. But it's at least worth considering potential impacts and contemplating sensible rules of the road early on, writes David Speers.

title.children: Eight years ago, Airbnb was a new platform with a hidden dark side. Now the warnings are sounding again

image.altText: Tennis fans cool off at the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: As Australia prepares for hot and dry months after the declaration of an El Niño, a stark reminder of the increasing danger posed by heatwaves in Australia's southern cities may lie ahead.

title.children: El Niño makes a scorching summer more likely. These cities might feel it most

image.altText: To young men look at camera and make hand signs. One of their faces in blurred

props.synopsis: The court heard Josiah Binsaris allegedly broke into a woman’s home along with two other assailants and brutally assaulted her and her partner, while cloaked in a mask.

title.children: Former Don Dale inmate refused bail over alleged home invasion, weeks after $220k payout

image.altText: The silhouette of a firefighter is seen in front of a large bushfire burning high into trees.

props.synopsis: Catastrophic fire danger warnings have been issued in parts of Australia already as it enters a hotter and drier than average climate pattern. If the fire season has taken you by surprise, here's a reminder of how the warning system works.

title.children: What makes a bushfire alert 'catastrophic', and how should you respond?

image.altText: LeBron James stands in front of a white board.

props.synopsis: Five years ago, LeBron James set out to fix some of America's most difficult problems. Some question whether the project is living up to its promises.

title.children: 'The stakes are really high for him': The NBA idol who bet his reputation on a radical social experiment

image.altText: Wind turbines are set to dot the landscape in Victoria's west

props.synopsis: Some experts are warning Australia's ambitions to have zero carbon emissions by 2050 need to be scaled up dramatically.

title.children: Reaching net zero by 2035 would take a 'gargantuan' effort. But these experts say our current 2050 target is just too far away

image.altText: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy addresses a high level Security Council meeting.

props.synopsis: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy takes the floor at the UN Security Council to lash 'criminal' Russia before foreign secretary Sergei Lavrov unloads for Russia.

title.children: As Russia ignores Zelenskyy at UN they're reminded they 'can stop the war' any time they like

image.altText: A baby being held with an arm around her head and a line with dots on her back. A white peg is being pushed on their back.

props.synopsis: Australia has some of the highest rates of food allergy in the world but the way we test for these potentially fatal conditions is unreliable and leading to misdiagnoses, say experts.

title.children: 'This puts lives at risk': Skin prick tests can be unreliable, especially if you have a seafood allergy

image.altText: A jar of honey is filled using an automatic dispenser

props.synopsis: Research into varroa mite is expected to surge after Australia waved the white flag in its fight to eradicate the pest from New South Wales, a decision that is also expected to increase beekeeping costs.

title.children: Will living with varroa mite make Australian honey and food more expensive?

image.altText: Gregor and Irma Palasics

props.synopsis: For 24 years, ACT police have followed often false leads in their quest to find the two men responsible for the brutal killing of Irma Palasics in 1999. Now, they say one of those men is behind bars.

title.children: The twists and turns of the investigation into Irma's murder have finally led to an answer

image.altText: Researcher digging things from underground.

props.synopsis: Archaeologists say they have unearthed the oldest wooden structure ever discovered, near Zambia's Kalambo Falls.

title.children: Wooden structure from before time of homo sapiens found in Zambia

image.altText: Reserve Bank Governor Ian Macfarlane makes a point

props.synopsis: The proposed move to establish a separate body within the Reserve Bank to make interest rates decisions in future, was "very bad policy" and "a leap of faith" which would undermine the authority of the governor, according to former governor Ian Macfarlane.

title.children: 'Very bad policy': Former RBA governor calls for discussions around bank's changes

image.altText: Joanne Baker stacking a fridge with soft drinks

props.synopsis: As debate over the Voice continues around the country, locals in this remote South Australian community are focused on issues closer to home.

title.children: This town only has enough jobs for 15 per cent of locals. The community is working to change that

image.altText: people sitting on the ground, digging for bones

props.synopsis: You don't need to be a palaeontologist to dig up dinosaur bones. These volunteers are unearthing a 95-million-year-old sauropod skeleton near Winton, proving all you need is curiosity and a keen eye.

title.children: At this outback dig, volunteers with a lifelong passion for dinosaurs are 'finding new bones every day'

image.altText: a young woman sick with a cold sitting on a bed blowing her nose with a tissue

props.synopsis: Queensland's chief health officer says the public should be "alert but not alarmed", after a surge in Group A Streptococcus infections. Here's how to stay safe.

title.children: 'Rare' strep A infections have jumped in Queensland, with a childcare worker currently in hospital

image.altText: Richard Scolyer holds up his hands while speaking at the National Press Club

props.synopsis: Richard Scolyer is at the forefront of melanoma treatment and research, but a devastating cancer diagnosis of his own has made him the self-described "patient zero" in a new frontier of brain cancer treatment.

title.children: 'Nothing short of phenomenal': Cancer expert undergoing experimental treatment reporting promising results

image.altText: Oscar Piastri gives a thumbs up

props.synopsis: Australia's Oscar Piastri cements his place at McLaren alongside Lando Norris as he targets future F1 success.

title.children: Piastri extends McLaren F1 deal, takes veiled shot at Alpine

image.altText: A Pizza Hut sign.

props.synopsis: Pizza Hut Australia says the data breach only impacted the Australian market and does not affect Pizza Hut's operations in any other country.

title.children: Nearly 200k Pizza Hut customers affected by cyber hack

image.altText: A damaged residential building and cars in the city of Stepanakert.

props.synopsis: Azerbaijan and Armenian forces reach a ceasefire agreement to end two days of fighting in the separatist Nagorno-Karabakh region

title.children: Dozens killed before Azerbaijan and Armenian forces reach ceasefire deal for breakaway region

image.altText: A metal monster sculpture on a pink lake under a bright blue sky with fluffy white clouds.

props.synopsis: The town of Lochiel in South Australia plans a unique feast in the style of the Diner en Blanc phenomenon, to help strengthen social connections and boost its drought resilience.

title.children: After the 'biggest drought' in living memory, town looks to its famous pink lake for deep reserves of resilience

image.altText: A man stands with a small hive of bees in a forest setting.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian beekeepers are on alert after the mainland gave up on eradicating the varroa mite — but one local apiarist sees the march of the deadly parasitic pest as an "opportunity" for the island's industry.

title.children: Will the 'moat' of Bass Strait keep varroa mite at bay and save Tasmania's bees?

image.altText: Seven men stand with three women while holding a football jersey.

props.synopsis: A majority of players summoned for national duties stay at the team's training camp after being told some of their demands for reform would be met. But two players opt to leave, after promises they would not be punished.

title.children: Most of Spain's national women's soccer team ends boycott after government intervenes

image.altText: A woman looks out to the distance wearing a black wide brimmed hat.

props.synopsis: Speaking at an event in honour of her late father, the activist Charles Perkins, filmmaker Rachel Perkins says it's "depressing" how many people still don't know what the Voice is.

title.children: Lack of understanding about the Voice 'alarming' as referendum approaches, filmmaker says

image.altText: Paul has dark hair and a beard and wears a blue jacket with white flowers on his lapel and a patterned bowtie

props.synopsis: Police have charged an 18-year-old Belmont man with the murder of 40-year-old Paul Grapsas, whose body was found hours after he left home for a late-night dog walk last Thursday.

title.children: Police charge 18-year-old man with murder of Geelong father Paul Grapsas

image.altText: A white and purple passenger plane on a runway.

props.synopsis: The budget carrier has announced its arrival into the NT's aviation market, and is promising to provide more competition and lower fares to tourists and locals.

title.children: Budget airline Bonza announces new flight routes to and from the Northern Territory

image.altText: A group of women wearing hijabs and masks walk through a colourful outdoor market.

props.synopsis: Iranian women who break the country's strict dress code can face up to 10 years of prison under a bill passed by Iran's parliament on Wednesday.

title.children: Women in Iran may face 10 years jail for not wearing hijab under proposed new laws

image.altText: A woman in dark clothing walks along holding the hand of an older man.

props.synopsis: A woman who had no recollection of having a knife in her hand when she fatally stabbed her close friend is acquitted of any criminal responsibility over his death.

title.children: Perth woman walks free after row over 'kebabs, keys and money' turned fatal

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie runs his hand over his hair while standing between two people

props.synopsis: A police interview with Danushka Gunathilaka played before the court shows the Sri Lankan cricketer crying and recalling the pair's interaction.

title.children: Cricketer Danushka Gunathilaka found sexual assault accuser 'a bit weird' after talk of past lives, court hears

image.altText: A post office as seen through the windscreen of a car at night.

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old driver pleads guilty in Millicent after a video showing a car doing burnouts through the town's main street was widely circulated.

title.children: Teen leaves court on BMX after burnout video goes viral

image.altText: A pile of ants with large, swollen abdomens full of honey, on red soil.

props.synopsis: A study finds secretions from the abdomen of the honeypot ant possess unique antimicrobial properties that make it effective against the golden staph bacteria.

title.children: Could this traditional Indigenous medicine one day help treat deadly golden staph?
